sections.description: An illustration of a television game show with a host and a computer. The computer is labeled MT2.

Noisemaker
Second Noisemaker
MT2, a computer
A boy and a girl from the audience

sections.line: Good evening, ladies and gentlemen. Welcome to The Computer Game. Today another human player gets a chance to match wits with our very own computer - MT2!

sections.content: (MT2 blinks its lights and the studio audience claps loudly.)

sections.line: Today's player is Joan Robinson from the Oak Street School. Feeling smart, Joan?
Ready!

I hope so! May I remind you no one has beaten MT2 yet. Now, here's how we play the game. I'll ask a question. The first player to sound a noise maker and give the correct answer scores one point. The first player to earn three points wins the game. Ready, players?
Ready!
I am prepared to play.
First question. How much is 62,415 times 78,921?
BLEEP!
The correct answer is 4,925,854,215.
Right! One point for the computer!
NA
Next question. In which year was the Battle of Hastings fought?
BLEEP!
1066. The answer is 1066. One point for MT2. The score is 2-0. What is your next question, master?
I am not your master. Now, for the third and final question. What are the first three words of the American Declaration of Independence?
BLEEP!
The first three words of the American Declaration of Independence are 'When in the...'
Wait! Wait! The noise-maker went off too soon.

That's correct, Joan. The noise-maker has to go off after I finish the question. So, MT2, you did not win that point. The score is 2-0. Now, for the next question. What is the spelling of 'chrysanthemum'?
BUZZ!
C-h-r-y-s-a-n-t-h-e-m-u-m.
That's right! One point for Joan! The score is 2-1.
BUZZ!
What happens if a human beats a computer?
I cannot answer that question. It is not in my program.
The computer is right. We're only programmed for questions. Now, for the final question. Is this the right question? And if it is, can you answer it?
The question is not a question. It is not a question at all. It is a statement.

sections.content: MT2's lights start to flash wildly and smoke pours out of its top.

sections.line: The computer is breaking down!
Then Joan's the winner!
It seems that way. This is a first for our show.
I knew it! The computer cannot handle questions that require intelligence.
